label: unconfig
content: Removed Berrybrew from PATH

label: available_header
content: The following Strawberry Perls are available:

label: available_footer
content: * Currently using

label: config_intro
content: This is berrybrew, version

label: clone_command_usage
content: Usage: berrybrew clone <orig_perl_name> <new_perl_name>

label: config_success
content: berrybrew was successfully added to PATH, start a new terminal to use it.

label: config_failure
content: Error adding berrybrew to PATH

label: config_complete
content: berrybrew is already configured on this system.

label: install_ver_required
content: install command requires a version argument
Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: install_ver_unknown
content: Unknown version of Perl
Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: modules_command_required
content: modules command requires a sub option. Run 'berrybrew modules help' for details

label: virtual_command_required
content: virtual command requires a name for the virtual instance.

label: register_ver_required
content: register command requires a directory as an argument.

label: switch_ver_required
content: switch command requires a version argument.
Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: remove_ver_required
content: remove command requires a version argument.
Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: use_ver_required
content: use command requires a version argument.
Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: error_number_required
content: error command requires an error code number argument.

label: exec_command_required
content: exec command requires a command to run.

label: perl_unknown_version
content: Unknown version of Perl. Use the available command to see what versions of Strawberry Perl are available

label: perl_orphans
content: Orphaned Perl installations:

label: help
content: berrybrew <command> [subcommand] [option]
associate *    View and set Perl file association
available *    List available Strawberry Perl versions and which are installed
list           List installed Strawberry Perl versions
clean *        Remove all temporary berrybrew files
clone          Make a complete copy of a Perl installation
config         Add berrybrew to your PATH
exec *         Run a command for every installed Strawberry Perl
fetch          Update the list of Strawberry Perl instances available
hidden         Display the list of hidden/development commands
install        Download, extract and install a Strawberry Perl
modules *      Export and import a module list from one Perl to install on another
options *      Display or set a single option, or display all of them with values
off            Disable berrybrew perls (use 'switch' to re-enable)
register       Manually register a custom installation directory
remove         Uninstall a Strawberry Perl
switch *       Switch to use a different Strawberry Perl
unconfig       Remove berrybrew from PATH
use *          Use a specific Strawberry Perl version temporarily
virtual        Allow berrybrew to manage an external Perl instance
help           Display this help screen
license        Show berrybrew license
version        Displays the version
* - view subcommand details with 'berrybrew <command> help'

label: hidden
content: berrybrew <command> [subcommand] [option]
currentperl            Print the name of the Perl currently in use
info                   Displays directory path information about the installation
download               Download a single or all versions of perl
error                  Displays the name of an exit status number
error-codes            Displays the list of valid exit codes, one per line
exit                   Test the exit routine by supplying an exit code
options-update         Adds any newly added config file directives to the Registry
options-update-force   Reloads the entire configuration file into the Registry
orphans                Display all orphaned Perl instances that aren't registered
register-orphans       Registers all orphan Perls at once
test                   Sets test platform information when running unit tests
trace                  Displays the full stack trace and exit code on exit
status                 Displays the exit code and its reference name on exit
* - view subcommand details with 'berrybrew <command> help'

label: subcmd.associate
content: berrybrew 'associate' options:
set    '.pl' file extensions will be managed by berrybrew
unset  Restore the previous file association configuration

label: subcmd.available
content: berrybrew 'available' subcommands:
all    List all available Perls, not just the most recent point release of each major version

label: subcmd.clean
content: berrybrew 'clean' subcommands:
all    Clean everything
build  Deletes the staging build directory
dev    Deletes all files/directories related to berrybrew development
module Deletes the exported module list directory
orphan Deletes all orphaned Perl installations
temp   Removes all downloaded Perl installation files

label: info_option_required
content: 'info' command requires an option argument to be send in. Valid options:
archive_path
root_path
install_path
bin_path

label: subcmd.switch
content: berrybrew 'switch' subcommands:
<version> [quick]
Adding the 'quick' parameter, we'll switch to the new Perl without needing a new console. Binaries and other features may not work correctly.

label: subcmd.exec
content: berrybrew 'exec' subcommands:
--with perlver,perlver <command>
Execute a command across only select versions of Perl

label: subcmd.modules
content: berrybrew 'modules' subcommands:
export  Exports a list of all installed modules in the current Perl
import  Imports a previously exported module list and installs them in the current perl

label: subcmd.options
content: berrybrew 'options' usage:
berrybrew options [option] [value]
With no options, we'll display all of them with their values

label: subcmd.use
content: berrybrew 'use' subcommands:
perlver,perlver
Use the given version (or versions) of Perl temporarily,
inside your original command window, by putting the selected
Perl version at the start of your path.
When done with a given version, type exit to leave that
version's environment, and either move on to the next version,
or return to your original environment if there are no more
selected versions to use
--win perlver,perlver
--window perlver,perlver
--windowed perlver,perlver
Use the given version (or versions) of Perl temporarily,
with each new version spawning its own command window.
When done with a given version, type exit to close that window.
